issue.title: CI: Consider using azure pipelines?
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-3224](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-3224). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/blog/announcing-azure-pipelines-with-unlimited-ci-cd-minutes-for-open-source/

It might simplify / speed up arrow's CI builds and/or the packaging. Does anyone have an experience with it?
Pros based on the blog post: 
- supports win, osx, linux
- 10 parallel builds

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-3224?focusedCommentId=16612050) by Antoine Pitrou (apitrou):*
No direct experience from me, but CPython has experimentally started using it, you can find the build definitions here:

https://github.com/python/cpython/tree/master/.vsts
